Fresh katsuo is yummy when it is in season. Basically, though, there 
are conventions for lots of these things. $B%$%+(B is pretty unambiguous as a 
katakana words go. The alternative $B$$$+(B takes one more stroke to write, 
and does not have a readability penalty. As you have probably been 
told, $B%+%?%+%J(B($BJR2>L>(B) looks more masculine while $B$R$i$,$J(B ($BJ?2>L>(B) looks more 
feminine.
